page.title: 15RECREATION IN OLD NEWICK
page.content: Today we have a great deal of leisure time, whereas in the past there was little time for recreation but there are many similarities between the sports of then and now. In the Middle Ages travelling jugglers, acrobats and performing bears would have come regularly to the Green, just as the fair still comes today. Hunting the fox (and the wolf in the past) has always been a popular,if controversial pastime. Other sports were archery (promoted by Henry VIII), football (an exceedingly rough game, involving many balls and many players), gambling and dicing, tennis (for the rich only) and bowling. All these sports are popular today although their manner and their rules may have changed somewhat. One sport which has fortunately died out is cudgel play where they tried to crack each others' skulls with sticks!
